caption: Tastes like feet a large slice is really the size of a foot.  So gross
Abruptly rude. Laughed as i walked out. Burnt pizza. Dont waste your money.
If u love pizza, then you might want to go check Si-Pie Pizzeria.
New to the neighborhood and ordered for the first time.  We got the 18” pepperoni. Good pizza with tons of cheese. Will order again.

Really good spot for a quick slice of pizza. The sauce is exactly what you want on a big slice of pizza like that, flavorful but not overpowering. The guys who run the counter are always cordial at a minimum, and in my experience have been friendly and conversational much of the time. Definitely check this place out if you’re in the mood for a local pizza joint!
Don’t get the wings. Stick with the pizza.
(Translated by Google) The worst pizzas in chicago the place is disgusting.  (Original) Las peores pizzas de chicago el lugar es un asco.
This is my favorite neighborhood pizza spot. The pizza is always fresh. The cheese is top quality and lots of it! Support you local pizza place!

This pizza place really does not know how to make a good pizza. They're extremely skimpy on ingredients, every slice only has maybe 1 or 2 bites of the smallest morsels they can find, the rest was just cheese, and even the cheese wasn't even that much. It really felt like a bottom shelf frozen pizza. The crust was ok, but slightly undercooked, it was still a little pale. The amount on each pizza is not worth the price. The sauce was a bad choice to, I ordered the spicy sauce and it tasted sweet instead of savory.

The same address sells under brown's famous fried chicken on grubhub taking advantage of people relying on deliveries these days. Food was bad and tasted like being fried in dirty old oil. Always do a little research before ordering deliveries to avoid being ripped off by shady businesses like this. Shameful
Very poor management. Very poor customer service. Please do not support.
Super cool pizza place with delicious pizza. Simon gives awesome customer service. A must eat place!
Excellent service with excellent food. They even delivered food to a polling place for all of the volunteer election workers, which is just awesome!

I ordered 2 Italian beef sandwiches, owner had no mask, and never stopped talking on the phone. Even when about to prepare the meat. Then I noticed, he rubbed his nose. I asked him to cancel my order. He said ok. Then I told him, that the reason I cancelled was that he never stopped his phone conversation, which. Was not even related to the business. He then told me to get the f---k out and never to come back again.
Dirty place, rude workers and long wait time. Unprofessional stuff
If you wanna waste you time, go to this place. They never have AC.

I’ve been living down the street for two weeks now and been going for single slices. Manager(maybe owner?) aka mans always running the counter, is the best guy around. While it’s easy to grab a slice and run out, i enjoy my conversations with him. Support this business, amazing pizza, better people - Luke
Amazingly delicious pizza with excellent service 🍕 Cute guy too 😜
None of the staff was wearing masks when I picked up a late night slice the other night. Will be reporting to 311.
Love it the people the food is wonderful
Tasty pizza, easy pickup using the Slice app
Just another low tier restaurant. Your money is better spent at McDonald's 👍

Called to check on my half hour late order. I was extremely polite and was just asking where the order was. Was met with the owner who was extremely rude and has no people or customer skills. He proceeded to called my personal number to tell me to not to order from the restaurant again. Don't you worry I won't. And neither should any of you. My philly philly cheese steak was clearly cooked by a 2 year old who can't operate a stove and burnt it completely and was rock hard.

My family and I ordered and waited an hour (and then some) over our delivery time. After calling and asking about our order and its delivery status, the manager became defensive, began screaming, and told us not to order from them again. The level of unprofessionalism is absolutely bewildering and the food was disgusting at best. Save your money and order elsewhere.
literally the worst food I have ever had.
BEWARE!!! MY ROOMMATES AND I GOT FOOD POISONING FROM HERE TWICE. TRIED TO SPEAK WITH THE OWNER AND HE TOLD NOT TO ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN. WHAT A TERRIBLE PERSON!!!
Food is horrible don't ever go to this place. Don't waste your money. Absolutely a rip off.

Ordered from here last night at 10:47pm through the slice app, order was accepted, and an expected delivery time (between 11:45 and 11:55 pm) was given to me. When the expected delivery time came around, my food was still not here, but I decided to give them some more time and wait it out. Waited 30 mins (the restaurant was now closed) and contacted Slice to try and see what was going on. Their customer service called and no answer. I called and no answer. It was now two hours since I placed the order and there was no food or even an update from the restaurant. Thankfully, Slice canceled the order for me and refunded me, but this was just insane. Horrible experience, especially when it was late and I was starving. Won’t be ordering from here again I’ll tell you that.
I would give this pizza five stars if the crust were better. It has the appearance and taste of gluten free crust, which is disappointing.
Great quick & easy pizza place. The owner was very sweet and gave me some extra treats to cheer up my roommate who was having a bad day. Quick, polite service!

When we received our order it was wrong. The pizza was cold and the garlic knots were rock hard. It was evident that our order was with the delivery guy for quite a while before getting to us since the food was not fresh. Will not be frequenting this place again with all the other pizza joints in Chicago.

The owner is a huge impolite person, to guests and his employees.  No personality from answering the phone to ending the call.   The pizza is ok, it’s dry but greasy. The greasy part is the good part.  Again very rude and then they look at you when you don’t tip.  Lol. Duh.  Step it up.

Just tried their pizza. Amazing. The sauce is real good, has a little bit of spice with some sweetness at the end. Also loved the fact that it wasn’t to greasy. My new go to place for pizzas. Welcomed addition to the neighborhood. Staff is also very friendly and delivery was very fast. Try it out!
YUUUUM!!!! Also, the customer service was AWESOME!! Thanks guys!
The pizza taste was good but I was concerned about hygiene because I saw that they didn’t wear gloves while preparing the pizza
I love this restaurant very much. It has a romantic atmosphere. The food is great. the service is effective and the waiters are polite. The pay is fair. truly recommend.
Showed up on time
Best pizza , cool owner and vibe
Super delicious, and very cheesy pizza. Love it!
BEST PIZZA on the north side! Staff is very friendly, great with their customers!
Big slice, small quality. Open late though.
Always awesome

This place has a lot of good reviews so I was super disappointed when I tried the pizza especially a $30 one! This was one of the worst pizzas I've ever had.  It was very soggy and possibly undercooked.  There were no spices anywhere to be found - probably the most bland pizza ever.  The crust was tasteless and soggy.  The one thing they did well was the toppings were generous but again so seasoning at all.  You are better off going anywhere else or just pickup a frozen pizza.
Big ol slices of pretty thin pizza.
Amazing pizza with generous slices and great prices. The owner is so kind and funny, and makes everyone feel welcome and cared for. This is a must-try for great priced, great food.
Good pizza, super friendly staff!

I've ordered from si pie many times and it stands by its value. Pizza is well made, it isn't the cheapest or fanciest, but it delivers a great taste for the value. A great source of local flavor for NYC style pizza in Chicago.
Excellent place to eat an very friendly

crust has no flavor, and it’s regular size for a 30-40 dollar pizza. I thought the prices were inflated and it would be huge but that’s not the case. Crazy that it has above 4 stars, definitely not going back.

I absolutely love Si-Pie and the owners. The authentic, friendly staff is just extra delicious toppings on an already tasty pizza. They also do thin crust GF pizzas (for an extra charge) with crust that is especially moist and chewy, given that it's gluten-free. This is a great staple for a lazy night in with a pizza and wings.

Very good place to stop by if you’re in the mood for pizza. I’m lucky to have it just down the street from my home. I normally just buy the slices which are HUGE. I love they are still open after being out on Halsted. Perfect pizza for the perfect occasion.
the pepperoni is soooo good. i love this place. highly recommend
Great pizza. Really nice people.

Overall it was okay.  Their Pizza is pretty good and it's a decent-size.  the Greek salad I ordered was $8.50 and it was so tiny for the price it wasn't worth.  I also ordered chicken tenders again there was maybe three of them and they more felt like a half tender not even a full tender so not worth it.
Ordered a sandwich and got just bread
had pizza here once when I was 7 (i turned 8 4 months ago :steamhappy: 😀😀😁) and I ate it upside down for some reason
Served up a big plate of rudeness. Pizza tasted mediocre after that experience.
took forever for  order to be ready when food is placed 45 minutes prior

The pizza was pretty good but the customer service was embarrassingly atrocious. When I asked for help with the fountain drinks (there was another person who actually asked the counter for help), the cashier walked over and spoke to me like I was an idiot, despite him actually finding an issue with the despenser.  I also asked to break a 20, and he said only if I bought something. When I did and asked for the change, he said that 'they don't do that here,' completely disregarding what he said 2 minutes previous.  I am very dissapointed since I just moved to the area and was ecstatic to have a pizza place so close. Unfortunately, that was the first and last time I'll be a customer.

Slices are HUGE. Look at my pic, that’s a 9 inch plate. No doubt about it. Slice and a fountain drink is the best deal. It’s a bit greasy but that’s really what you are buying. Sodas are “Si-pie” branded. The lemonade is great. Open late.
Best customer service, really really delicious pizza
New York style pizza by the pie or slice.
Simon always serves a smile and  great food. Best pizza Best chiken wings.
Love the pizza and meatballs!! Yum!!
The slices are HUGE. Delicious, yummy and satisfied my pizza craving. We also ordered wings, which I highly recommend! Very nice staff and quick service.
Great pizza, only complaint is they don’t cut tavern style.
Great food and the owner is a wonderful guy. We'll be back for sure when we visit Chicago again next year.
The owner is cool
Simon is good
The sauce is amazing.  Great place to eat!
Chicken shwarma pizza is poppin
Quick service, great food, awesome owner!

Today I ordered garlic bread knots, chicken wings, veggie pizza & barbecue chicken pizza. The food was pathetic. Garlic knots were not cooked, chicken wings were smelly and the pizza bed was very very dry. I am not ordering food again from this place.
Canceled my post mates for no reason

Being a diabetic I'm very careful with my sugar and carb intake, I took my meds and had a slice of sausage and my sugar before eating the slice was at 108, after I ate it went up to 127 and 4 hours later down to 117. Very good pizza and a very big slice too, it fills you up for $5. Btw I took 15 units of novolin prior to eating my slice. I hope this helps any member that's part of the sugar club.
I don't understand why this place has as high a rating as they do. The cheese pizza is dry. The sausage pizza is barely edible. The crust tastes like a cracker.
Service was good, Garlic cheese knots/balls were good and they had Mortal Combat! But, It was a pit stop and the pizza was a tad bit better than gas station pizza.

$5 per slice 😱 I ordered a slice of cheese and pepperoni, which were pretty aged and under a heat lamp in the store. The cook explained that they sell two normal slices in a “slice,” and 8 normal slices in a pie. Fine with more food, but with math I ended up paying 300% markup per slice compared to just getting a whole pie (start at $12 for cheese). Totinos party pizza is cheaper and tastes better🤦🏼‍♂️
Yesss
(Translated by Google) Very good pizza  (Original) Muy buena pizza
The owner is a con man with fake one hundred dollar bills
Great pizza!

Good pizza and quick serving. Super good crust and tasty.  Lots of different topping options.  We ordered the house pizza and it was loaded with toppings.  They definitely aren't stingy with them.  It was a good price for good pizza.
Yum

This is your quintessential jumbo pizza slice place, except the people working there are legitimately always friendly, whether it's 11:30 at night or 1 in the afternoon. I've never had bad pizza or service here and it completely satisfies my taste for 'za every time.

Pizza was decent but was very undercooked. Had to put it back in my own oven for 15 mins at 425 for it to finish cooking. Plus, I ordered sausage, green pepper, and onions, and all three were skimpy. I don't even think there was a single green pepper actually. Wings are very small and overpriced.
The best pizza I ever had. The service was fast and friendly even though they were super busy. I will be back again and again
Always a fantastic slice of pizza, always a gracious owner.
Amazing pizza fresh toppings, and the customer service is off the wall. 🔥🔥
Food is unbelievable delicious and owner is really funny

Went in for a slice right when it opened. Ended up with a delicious slice of veggie and a great conversation with the owner. Extremely pleasant guy who seemed to have something to say to everybody that stopped by. He creates a great atmosphere and it's worth coming for that alone.
Big tasty thin slices, great wings & service

This is the best pizza I've ever had in my life...literally. I use to go here on my lunch breaks and I always was pleased with my meal every single time. The guy that's behind the counter was slightly inattentive, but I was happy to get my jumbo slice of pizza (hot & ready to eat). The only downsides are that this place is small and you can't get other toppings on your pizza unless it's a whole pizza. Well, at least that's what he told me, so yeah. I'm slightly upset that it's only 2 of these places that I know of, and they are both located far from me. I have to do quite a bit of travel just to get a slice.
Very good lunch. Very large slice of pizza and soda for $5.
Excellent food! Garlic knots and pizza were both amazing. The owner was very welcoming. And made you feel right at home. Will definitely be back!

Called to order a pizza when slicelife wasn't working.  I talked to the owner Simon directly, and he apologized for the inconvenience and said if I was willing to pick it up, he would make me one for free.  He threw an order of garlic knots on top.  Great pizza, excellent service.

I am so upset, I spent $40 on wings, a salad, a "pizza" and some garlic knots, that are hard as a rock. I ordered thru grub hub so naturally I went to them, the restaurant agreed to give me 20% off of my bill. The food is not edible and this is how they want to reward their customers. I am in shock that they did not even offer to remake the food. Avoid this place at all costs. There are plenty of pizza places that respect their customers and would want to make the situation right. This is place does not deserve to call itself a restaurant. The wings did not even have sauce on them.

This has been a favorite of mine for ordering out in the neighborhood for a few years now. Recently I used a delivery app, and the driver never showed up and for some reason the app would not allow another driver to pick up the order, I was on with customer service and it was not going very well. The owner of Si-Pie called me personally and sent me the pizza for free. Very classy act, I will remain a loyal and happy customer of Si-Pie for years to come. Give this place a shot! Love the bbq chicken pizza.
Amazing pizza !!!!
Best pizza in the city!!!! The owner has to be one of the nicest people in the business. We wish him much success!!
I loved this place

This food is a perfect five stars both for quality and value. But the online ordering experience is pretty bad. Food is not ready on time and the staff is pretty confused about online orders. And a little bit rude.  Sometimes it takes a few tries before they acknowledge your order exists.
YUCK !! ONE CANNOT CALL THIS PIZZA OR PIE ANYTHING, BUT SLOP !!
Workers were rude and after 20 minutes of waiting, after I was told it would take 12 minutes, I was told , “just deal with it.”
Impressively bland. Not terrible. Not amazing. Just meh.
Simon, the owner, was friendly and great. Pizza and pasta were excellent
Awesome pizza by the slice! This place is fast, afortable, and welcoming. Owner is super cool.

Terrible customer service for locals.Tried to support local business even though not the best quality but we just can't support them any more for delivery or carryout. Ordering from Lou's, Giordano's or even Domino's!
Yummy nice people

This place is great. The owner is really friendly and the pizza is amazing. Last time I was here he gave me a free garlic knot and it was sooo good!  Being from Atlanta I wouldn’t call it Chicago deep dish but more New York slice. Also, a slice is HUGE. I’d take a pic but it’s already gone. Sausage = Yum, Cheese = YUM! The sauce isn’t spicy so it’s as authentic as you can get.
This is the best vegan gluten free pizza I have had thus far. Brings me to tears.
How is this place a 'top 15 pizzeria' in Chicago?
Love this place! The owner is my friend Simon he is great, he has three restaurants open now. Check it out you won't be disappointed :-)
Amazing pizza!! Great customer service, love these guys!

Awesome pizza! The owner and staff were very friendly and helped us decide on the right size pizza for our small group, then happily chatted while it cooked. He told us, "It'll be 15 minutes" for our carry-out order, and we were headed out the door with a hot pizza almost exactly 15 mins later. Even though we ended up getting stuck in traffic in the way home, the pizza was perfect--chewy crust, flavorful sauce, with quality toppings. Will be back!
Beware...the slice prices are not posted. I was charged $12.50 for 2 slices and a drink and then watched everyone after me get a drink included with the purchase of their slice(s) at no charge.

The atmosphere is amazing here, the owner adds so much character to this place it really made my experience that much more enjoyable, and the guy is super funny and down to earth.  The pizza was great, especially if your only wanting to spend 5 bucks you get a slice as big as your head with a drink for a total of $5.50.  Now not only was the pizza delicious but the all you can drink craft soda was delish, I guzzled down the Dr. Pie.  All in all, great place to go after a few drinks or for a quick bite. As much as I love Homerun Inn or Giardons I don't always want to drop 40 bucks on pizza. I will definatly be returning with my friends when I'm back in Chicago.
Solid New York style pizza. Everything I've had has been really good.

I actaully checked out their new location at Sheffield and Roscoe.  Great place!  Grab a quick slice of pizza before heading to the Cubs game or after a late night at the bar.  The slices are Huge and inexpensive!  Looking forward to trying some of their other menu items that have come highly recommended by co-workers.  Plus, the staff is extremely friendly!
The owner/operator is Simon. He puts his heart and soul into making his delicious and unique pizzas. He is also a major supporter of the community, the fire department, and law enforcement.
Spectacular foods choices, awesome pizza, and very good service,and nice people

Si-Pie is a fabulous place to have some delicious food. I know them for their huge slice of pizza of whatever topping is offered. The pizza’s sauce is outstanding and made to perfection.  The staff is very welcoming and kind as well! I live pretty close by and I know I can always count on this great establishment to provide great service and phenomenal food. Cheers!
For a big delious piece of pizza, or for many other wonderful menu items such as chicken,  Si-Pizza is the place.  Simon and his fabulous  staff are ready to serve you today!
Been there one time and if their pizza slices are that good for lunch I can only imagine how delicious their fresh to order pizza is.
Loved the pizza here! Will always be coming back. The owner is an outstanding person who cares about his service and food.
Great cheap, fast, delicious late night pizza by the slice
Great food and great service.
Nice

Love me some SiPies!! The best pizza ever!!! I love the chicken shawarma pizza simply amazing!  The owner Simon is awesome, he is so friendly and makes you feel at home. Definitely my top recommendation.
Greasy
Very good food

Highly recommend this place. Walked in around 330 in the afternoon to grab a quick bite while getting my laundry done next door. I looked at the pizza by the slices and the owner immediately offered it to me free of charge since he said they’ve been sitting for a bit. I accepted but still ordered more since I was ravenous.  After chatting with him some more and I mentioned it’s my first time in, he offered to put whatever I wanted on a quarter of a fresh pie to try out his place.  Clean place, awesome owner, great pizza. I’ll be back.

I gave the place 5 stars because the food is good. But I'm not doing it for just that. The employees there seem to never stop moving.  They work their tails off. No lie. I'm an uber driver and Every time I go there's two guys n they do it all. Amazing
I am the chef there come In and let me show you how hard we work to service your hunger needs
Great pizza! The new chef has made some great changes from before. I will be returning.
This is not NY style pizza. It’s not great pizza either.
The pizza is great.  The owner is awesome! Go there!
Surprisingly good pizza, tasty wings at a great price. Cool folks behind the counter, and it's usually a quick in and out.
Mediocre. Crust under cooked, unimaginative. Ingredients just Ok. Not cheap. Not a good reflection on Chicago.

My husband and I came to Chicago for 2 days only. This place was close to us, so we decided to try it out. The owner was just on the front and we were received with a big smile. He was just making pizzas as we walked in, so we got to taste the most fresh and thin crust pizza. I love pizza, but I don't settle for any, but this pizza was awesome! The staff is very friendly, the food is great, what else can you ask for. We are definitely coming back!

Friendliest service great value Free smells Relaxed :)  Update: I saw simon on the street and told him how awesome he was. He offered my friend and I a slice. I was blown away by his generosity. I saw a few guys down the street who needed a good bite and I paid it forward. So now these two guys can see the amazingness of your generosity too. So much good karma from this business!!
Best gluten free pizza in town, hands down. I am celiac and I have ordered from here many times and have never gotten sick. Thank you!
Great for a slice of pepperoni.

Was in there about an hour ago. Service sucked they could care less if we existed or not. As I look at these other comments about service being great I wonder if we went in there on a bad night. But I would not recommend to say the least. Pizza was not very good and again we were not impressed with the staff.

First of all the pizza (although not what I ordered) was pretty good after I took the green olives off... This is why I give 2 stars rather than one.  Other than that... Awful service. I receive my pizza to find it has been topped with green olives rather than the green peppers that I ordered. I'm a chill guy, no big deal, I'll just call to see what we can do.  I call to be greeted by the rude order taker who took my order in the first place. After explaining the topping mishap he proceeds to accuse me of saying "green olives" rather than apologize for a possible misunderstanding. First, I hate olives and would never utter the word in my life. Secondly, this is coming from the same order taker who 100% botched the name Tyler on my receipt and failed to add the "well done" I requested as well... so I wonder who was in the wrong. Seems to me he just wasn't listening.  Regardless who said what... treat your customers like you want them to come back. Got this place recommended by a friend and will be sure to pass along to never go here to everyone I encounter that enjoys pizza.  What a shame.
Ordered a pepperoni and bacon and got cheese. I mean it's tasty, just wrong
Fantastic pizza friendly staff grate place hot wings are wicked good
Really good 🍕, quick and easy atmosphere. And when you dine in unlimted soda.
Awesome​ food and service!
Pizza is good. Nice location and it is a cool spin.
Awesome owner and amazing NYC style pizza, reminds me of home and great customer service

The food is okay for the price. I've just had issues with my order... ordered 6 piece mozz stix and got 10 but the worse was ordering a salad with no meat and receiving it with.... they offered 15% though I couldn't eat it.
Pizza here is really good. Realistically you will probably find maybe 2-3 better places on the north side. You will not find a better or nicer staff in the whole city.
awesome NY-style thin crust, great service!

This place is a really good pizzeria! Always friendly people working there. Their pizza's and especially their toppings are consistently excellent. Also, their sides are good as well. Lived in this neighborhood for two years now and they are my all around favorite pizza joint(this is coming from someone who eats pizza three times a week, lol). Highly recommend!

This place has great pizza, and refreshing homemade sodas. It's not just a great "I'm drunk so the pizza tastes good place", it is really good pizza anytime. Prices are great, and ingredients are fresh. Its great that it is open late on weekend nights, and later than most places during the week. I'm a ride-share driver, and they have discounts for drivers, and a bathroom you can use.

One of my favorite pizza joints, my friend is a Vegan and eats pizza without cheese. They finally convinced me to try it, so I was like why not Si-Pie. I tried a bell pepper, mushroom, onion and hot giardiniera. I must say I was impressed.
Best gluten free pizza I have had in years. Lovely and classic proprieter as well!
We had a large sausage pizza delivered and while overall it was delicious,  it was sparce on the sausage.  Next time I would order double sausage.
Great place to drop in for a late night slice.
Great service good food all around a good place to hang out
Overpriced and tasted horrible,  the dough wasn't fully cooked.
Best pies and great service
Pizza was very good and they made it rather quickly.
😎 Local, Thin crust pizza, By the slice. 😅
Best Pizza I Slice Ever

Moved right around the corner and this is my go to pizza place. Always delicious and the people are so lovey!!! My boyfriend even requests this place and he's a picky pizza eater. Best pizza in this area by far.
Awesome pizza, great staff! Cool owner!

My boyfriend and I live nearby and have frequented Si-Pie since we moved in. Him more so because he has a higher calorie budget than myself unfortunately. Si-Pie is always our top pick when we just need something to eat right now! The pizza is always hot and delicious, and the service we receive is positively amazing. Usually we just get it by the slice, but when we do get a full pizza it's always ready for pickup and perfectly done fairly quick. Love the guys here and the idea of not being a 15 second walk from this place is painful to think about.
Best pizza by the slice around and the employees are always so nice

I've never seen such a horrible service. We ordered a pizza and a bottle of soda. We got the order confirmation per email with the expected delivery time. 45 minutes after the delivery time a pizza arrived but no soda. After the guy left we realized that it was the wrong pizza and that the pizza was completely cold. That was definitely the first and last time we ordered pizza there. I can not recommend Si-Pie Pizzeria.

It's micro wave pizza. If any one thinks this is good pizza  I have a bridge in Brooklyn I want to sell you.  They are cooking a pre fab crust in a toster oven . The sausage is sub standard  and the "cheese" is a joke.  Do yourself a favor, and keep your money in the pocket and find a pizza maker.  Try Aurelius pizza and get an education on pizza pie
Kev and I were in the city today...Si-Pie Pizzeria is a nice spot to hit up for NY STYLE PIES if you're ever in Chicago!! Simon(owner) is very personable and business savvy!!! #Illbeback
Great place to get a slice. Awesome customer service!!!

Never have a been to a pizza place and had such good service. The owner Simon runs everything by himself and works his tail off for the passion of running his own business. This guy is the true embodiment of a hard working Entrepreneur and the quest for the American dream. Not only is the pizza great but he goes out of his way to provide absolute top level customer service to the point of bringing the pizza to me when I was sitting down, to extra fixings, and polite conversation. All while running literally every aspect of the business by himself: cooking and making the pizza's, taking phone calls, processing orders, dealing with the other customers. Wow is all I can say. I want to see this guy succeed so bad that I urge everyone to give his pizza a try and support local Entrepreneurs. Its been a while since I have seen anyone as deserving as him. Lets give business back to all the deserving small businesses and entrepreneurs that help make America great. Thanks Simon!
Super Bowl MVP MOST VALUABLE PIZZA........  Great service, great food, great value.  This IS our "go-to" for pizza NO MATTER WHAT.
The thin crust by the slice is good, cheap, and huge! Great spot to grab a slice and go.
Si is the man

Came here with a friend. Behind a couple. Whole pizza available, gives couple ahead of us almost entire pizza. We ordered the last two premade slices. A guy comes in much later after we did and the guy behind the counter gives the last slices to him and ignores us. WOW! GREAT SERVICE (insert major sarcasm)
Great authentic artesian pizza!!
The pizza was one of the best pizzas I have ever had in Chicago. The owner and the atmosphere is great and I highly recommend this place. Fast delivery and one of Chicago's best pizza joints!
Extremely fresh. Simone your pizza is great, the si-pie spicy has to be my favorite. When I can't make it in , the delivery service is always accommodating and on time! Thanks!!
very tasty. good price
Hands Down this is the BEST pizza....Uncle Simon your great!! - your niece Meray
Working down the street, stopped in.  Got 2 slices not knowing they are folded over!  Great pie and I am totally full right now.  Great sauce.
Best pizza ever and huge pieces. One piece will fill you up, great staff also
Terrific thin crust pizza...more importantly, good people and excellent service!
Really good pizza. Even better service.
Great Piazza. Totally different experience  from any other Pizzeria i have been to."its guaranteed" who else would tell you that.You've gotta try it.

Being in the family restaurant business myself for over 25 years, I will tell you, this new little shop is doing everything right.  Simon, you make a perfect thin crust Pizza my friend!  Super tasty, hits the spot and then some.  Highly recommended!  Service with a smile too, a real one!
